$comment: OSCAL Unified Model of Models: JSON Schema

satisfied_implementation_responsibility.title: Satisfied Control Implementation Responsibility
satisfied_implementation_responsibility.description: Describes how this system satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

uuid.title: Satisfied Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this satisfied entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

responsibility_uuid.title: Provided UUID
responsibility_uuid.description: Identifies a 'provided' assembly associated with this assembly.

description.title: Satisfied Control Implementation Responsibility Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is implementing based on a requirement from a leveraged system.

inherited_control_implementation.title: Inherited Control Implementation
inherited_control_implementation.description: Describes a control implementation inherited by a leveraging system.

uuid.title: Inherited Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this inherited entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

provided_uuid.title: Provided UUID
provided_uuid.description: Identifies a 'provided' assembly associated with this assembly.

description.title: Inherited Control Implementation Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

control_implementation_responsiblity.title: Control Implementation Responsibility
control_implementation_responsiblity.description: Describes a control implementation responsibility imposed on a leveraging system.

uuid.title: Responsibility Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this responsibility entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

provided_uuid.title: Provided UUID
provided_uuid.description: Identifies a 'provided' assembly associated with this assembly.

description.title: Control Implementation Responsibility Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system must implement to satisfy the control provided by a leveraged system.

uuid.title: Catalog Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier for this catalog instance. This UUID should be changed when this document is revised.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: A group of controls, or of groups of controls.

id.title: Group Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for a specific group instance that can be used to reference the group within this and in other OSCAL documents. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same group across minor revisions of the document.

class.title: Group Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub_type or characterization of the group.

title.title: Group Title
title.description: A name given to the group, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

control.title: Control
control.description: A structured information object representing a security or privacy control. Each security or privacy control within the Catalog is defined by a distinct control instance.

id.title: Control Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for a specific control instance that can be used to reference the control in other OSCAL documents. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same control across minor revisions of the document.

class.title: Control Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub_type or characterization of the control.

title.title: Control Title
title.description: A name given to the control, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

part.title: Part
part.description: A partition of a control's definition or a child of another part.

id.title: Part Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for a specific part instance. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same part across minor revisions of the document.

name.title: Part Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type.

ns.title: Part Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

class.title: Part Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub_type or characterization of the part's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple parts of the same control with the same name and ns.

title.title: Part Title
title.description: A name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

prose.title: Part Text
prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

parameter.title: Parameter
parameter.description: Parameters provide a mechanism for the dynamic assignment of value(s) in a control.

id.title: Parameter Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for a specific parameter instance. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same parameter across minor revisions of the document.

class.title: Parameter Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a characterization of the parameter.

label.title: Parameter Label
label.description: A short, placeholder name for the parameter, which can be used as a substitute for a value if no value is assigned.

usage.title: Parameter Usage Description
usage.description: Describes the purpose and use of a parameter

parameter_constraint.title: Constraint
parameter_constraint.description: A formal or informal expression of a constraint or test

description.title: Constraint Description
description.description: A textual summary of the constraint to be applied.

items.title: Constraint Test
items.description: A test expression which is expected to be evaluated by a tool.

expression.title: Constraint test
expression.description: A formal (executable) expression of a constraint

parameter_guideline.title: Guideline
parameter_guideline.description: A prose statement that provides a recommendation for the use of a parameter.

prose.title: Guideline Text
prose.description: Prose permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

parameter_value.title: Parameter Value
parameter_value.description: A parameter value or set of values.

how_many.title: Parameter Cardinality
how_many.description: Describes the number of selections that must occur. Without this setting, only one value should be assumed to be permitted.

items.title: Choice
items.description: A value selection among several such options

metadata.title: Publication metadata
metadata.description: Provides information about the publication and availability of the containing document.

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

revision.title: Revision History Entry
revision.description: An entry in a sequential list of revisions to the containing document in reverse chronological order (i.e., most recent previous revision first).

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document revision, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

location.title: Location
location.description: A location, with associated metadata that can be referenced.

uuid.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined location elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions of the document.

title.title: Location Title
title.description: A name given to the location, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

items.title: Location URL
items.description: The uniform resource locator (URL) for a web site or Internet presence associated with the location.

location_uuid.title: Location Reference
location_uuid.description: References a location defined in metadata.

party.title: Party (organization or person)
party.description: A responsible entity which is either a person or an organization.

uuid.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined location elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given party across revisions of the document.

type.title: Party Type
type.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

name.title: Party Name
name.description: The full name of the party. This is typically the legal name associated with the party.

short_name.title: Party Short Name
short_name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the party.

items.title: Party External Identifier
items.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID)

scheme.title: External Identifier Schema
scheme.description: Indicates the type of external identifier.

items.title: Organizational Affiliation
items.description: Identifies that the party object is a member of the organization associated with the provided UUID.

party_with_name.title: Party (organization or person)
party_with_name.description: A responsible entity which is either a person or an organization.

uuid.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined location elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given party across revisions of the document.

type.title: Party Type
type.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

name.title: Party Name
name.description: The full name of the party. This is typically the legal name associated with the party.

short_name.title: Party Short Name
short_name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the party.

items.title: Party External Identifier
items.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID)

scheme.title: External Identifier Schema
scheme.description: Indicates the type of external identifier.

items.title: Organizational Affiliation
items.description: Identifies that the party object is a member of the organization associated with the provided UUID.

party_uuid.title: Party Reference
party_uuid.description: References a party defined in metadata.

role.title: Role
role.description: Defines a function assumed or expected to be assumed by a party in a specific situation.

id.title: Role Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for a specific role instance. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same role across minor revisions of the document.

title.title: Role Title
title.description: A name given to the role, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short_name.title: Role Short Name
short_name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the role.

description.title: Role Description
description.description: A summary of the role's purpose and associated responsibilities.

role_id.title: Role Identifier Reference
role_id.description: A reference to the roles served by the user.

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: A citation consisting of end note text and optional structured bibliographic data.

rlink.title: Resource link
rlink.description: A pointer to an external resource with an optional hash for verification and change detection.

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URI reference to a resource.

media_type.title: Media Type
media_type.description: Specifies a media type as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Media Types Registry.

resource.title: Resource
resource.description: A resource associated with content in the containing document. A resource may be directly included in the document base64 encoded or may point to one or more equivalent internet resources.

uuid.title: Resource Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined resource elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

title.title: Resource Title
title.description: A name given to the resource, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

description.title: Resource Description
description.description: A short summary of the resource used to indicate the purpose of the resource.

base64.title: Base64
base64.description: The Base64 alphabet in RFC 2045 _ aligned with XSD.

filename.title: File Name
filename.description: Name of the file before it was encoded as Base64 to be embedded in a resource. This is the name that will be assigned to the file when the file is decoded.

media_type.title: Media Type
media_type.description: Specifies a media type as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Media Types Registry.

back_matter.title: Back matter
back_matter.description: A collection of resources, which may be included directly or by reference.

property.title: Property
property.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which may be expressed as a list of values.

name.title: Property Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or quality of the property's containing object.

uuid.title: Property Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions of the document.

ns.title: Property Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

value.title: Property Value
value.description: Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.

class.title: Property Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub_type or characterization of the property's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple properties of the same object with the same name and ns.

link.title: Link
link.description: A reference to a local or remote resource

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to a resource.

rel.title: Relation
rel.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

media_type.title: Media Type
media_type.description: Specifies a media type as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Media Types Registry.

text.title: Link Text
text.description: A textual label to associate with the link, which may be used for presentation in a tool.

ssp_link.title: SSP Link
ssp_link.description: A reference to a local or remote SSP resource

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to a resource.

rel.title: Relation
rel.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

text.title: Link Text
text.description: A textual label to associate with the link, which may be used for presentation in a tool.

responsible_party.title: Responsible Party
responsible_party.description: A reference to a set of organizations or persons that have responsibility for performing a referenced role in the context of the containing object.

role_id.title: Responsible Role
role_id.description: The role that the party is responsible for.

responsible_role.title: Responsible Role
responsible_role.description: A reference to one or more roles with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object.

role_id.title: Responsible Role ID
role_id.description: The role that is responsible for the business function.

hash.title: Hash
hash.description: A representation of a cryptographic digest generated over a resource using a specified hash algorithm.

algorithm.title: Hash algorithm
algorithm.description: Method by which a hash is derived

remarks.title: Remarks
remarks.description: Additional commentary on the containing object.

published.title: Publication Timestamp
published.description: The date and time the document was published. The date-time value must be formatted according to RFC 3339 with full time and time zone included.

last_modified.title: Last Modified Timestamp
last_modified.description: The date and time the document was last modified. The date-time value must be formatted according to RFC 3339 with full time and time zone included.

version.title: Document Version
version.description: A string used to distinguish the current version of the document from other previous (and future) versions.

oscal_version.title: OSCAL version
oscal_version.description: The OSCAL model version the document was authored against.

email_address.title: Email Address
email_address.description: An email address as defined by RFC 5322 Section 3.4.1.

type.title: type flag
type.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

address.title: Address
address.description: A postal address for the location.

city.title: City
city.description: City, town or geographical region for the mailing address.

state.title: State
state.description: State, province or analogous geographical region for mailing address

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: Postal or ZIP code for mailing address

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The ISO 3166_1 alpha_2 country code for the mailing address.

addr_line.title: Address line
addr_line.description: A single line of an address.

document_id.title: Document Identifier
document_id.description: A document identifier qualified by an identifier scheme. A document identifier provides a globally unique identifier for a group of documents that are to be treated as different versions of the same document. If this element does not appear, or if the value of this element is empty, the value of "document_id" is equal to the value of the "uuid" flag of the top_level root element.

scheme.title: Document Identification Scheme
scheme.description: Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

profile.title: Profile
profile.description: Each OSCAL profile is defined by a Profile element

uuid.title: Catalog Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier for this profile instance. This UUID should be changed when this document is revised.

import.title: Import resource
import.description: The import designates a catalog, profile, or other resource to be included (referenced and potentially modified) by this profile. The import also identifies which controls to select using the include_all, include_controls, and exclude_controls directives.

href.title: Catalog or Profile Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to the base catalog or profile that this profile is tailoring.

merge.title: Merge controls
merge.description: A Merge element merges controls in resolution.

combine.title: Combination rule
combine.description: A Combine element defines whether and how to combine multiple (competing) versions of the same control

method.title: Combination method
method.description: How clashing controls should be handled

as_is.title: As is
as_is.description: An As_is element indicates that the controls should be structured in resolution as they are structured in their source catalogs. It does not contain any elements or attributes.

custom.title: Custom grouping
custom.description: A Custom element frames a structure for embedding represented controls in resolution.

profile_group.title: Control group
profile_group.description: A group of (selected) controls or of groups of controls

id.title: Group Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for a specific group instance that can be used to reference the group within this and in other OSCAL documents. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same group across minor revisions of the document.

class.title: Group Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub_type or characterization of the group.

title.title: Group Title
title.description: A name given to the group, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

modify.title: Modify controls
modify.description: Set parameters or amend controls in resolution

items.title: Parameter Setting
items.description: A parameter setting, to be propagated to points of insertion

param_id.title: Parameter ID
param_id.description: Indicates the value of the 'id' flag on a target parameter; i.e. which parameter to set

class.title: Parameter Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a characterization of the parameter.

label.title: Parameter Label
label.description: A short, placeholder name for the parameter, which can be used as a substitute for a value if no value is assigned.

usage.title: Parameter Usage Description
usage.description: Describes the purpose and use of a parameter

insert_controls.title: Select controls
insert_controls.description: Specifies which controls to use in the containing context.

order.title: Order
order.description: A designation of how a selection of controls in a profile is to be ordered.

include_all.title: Insert All
include_all.description: Insert all controls from the imported catalog or profile resources identified in the import directive.

call.title: Call
call.description: Call a control by its ID

with_child_controls.title: Include contained controls with control
with_child_controls.description: When a control is included, whether its child (dependent) controls are also included.

items.title: Match Controls by Pattern
items.description: Select controls by (regular expression) match on ID

pattern.title: Pattern
pattern.description: A glob expression matching the IDs of one or more controls to be selected.

alter.title: Alteration
alter.description: An Alter element specifies changes to be made to an included control when a profile is resolved.

control_id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control_id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value.

remove.title: Removal
remove.description: Specifies objects to be removed from a control based on specific aspects of the object that must all match.

by_name.title: Reference by (assigned) name
by_name.description: Identify items to remove by matching their assigned name

by_class.title: Reference by class
by_class.description: Identify items to remove by matching their class.

by_id.title: Reference by ID
by_id.description: Identify items to remove indicated by their id.

by_item_name.title: Item Name Reference
by_item_name.description: Identify items to remove by the name of the item's information element name, e.g. title or prop

by_ns.title: Item Namespace Reference
by_ns.description: Identify items to remove by the item's ns, which is the namespace associated with a part, or prop.

add.title: Addition
add.description: Specifies contents to be added into controls, in resolution

position.title: Position
position.description: Where to add the new content with respect to the targeted element (beside it or inside it)

title.title: Title Change
title.description: A name given to the control, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

component_definition.title: Component Definition
component_definition.description: A collection of component descriptions, which may optionally be grouped by capability.

uuid.title: Component Definition Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier for this component definition instance. This UUID should be changed when this document is revised.

import_component_definition.title: Import Component Definition
import_component_definition.description: Loads a component definition from another resource.

href.title: Hyperlink Reference
href.description: A link to a resource that defines a set of components and/or capabilities to import into this collection.

defined_component.title: Component
defined_component.description: A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

uuid.title: Component Identifier
uuid.description: The unique identifier for the component.

type.title: Component Type
type.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

title.title: Component Title
title.description: A human readable name for the component.

description.title: Component Description
description.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

capability.title: Capability
capability.description: A grouping of other components and/or capabilities.

uuid.title: Capability Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for a capability.

description.title: Capability Description
description.description: A summary of the capability.

component_uuid.title: Component Reference
component_uuid.description: A reference to a component by its identifier

description.title: Component Description
description.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

component_definition_control_implementat.title: Control Implementation Set
component_definition_control_implementat.description: Defines how the component or capability supports a set of controls.

uuid.title: Control Implementation Set Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for the set of implemented controls.

source.title: Source Resource Reference
source.description: A reference to an OSCAL catalog or profile providing the referenced control or subcontrol definition.

description.title: Control Implementation Description
description.description: A description of how the specified set of controls are implemented for the containing component or capability.

component_definition_implemented_require.title: Control Implementation
component_definition_implemented_require.description: Describes how the containing component or capability implements an individual control.

uuid.title: Control Implementation Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for a specific control implementation.

control_id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control_id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value.

description.title: Control Implementation Description
description.description: A description of how the specified control is implemented for the containing component or capability.

component_status.title: Status
component_status.description: Describes the operational status of the system component.

system_component.title: Component
system_component.description: A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

uuid.title: Component Identifier
uuid.description: The unique identifier for the component.

type.title: Component Type
type.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

title.title: Component Title
title.description: A human readable name for the system component.

description.title: Component Description
description.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

protocol.title: Service Protocol Information
protocol.description: Information about the protocol used to provide a service.

uuid.title: Service Protocol Information Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this service protocol entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

name.title: Protocol Name
name.description: The common name of the protocol, which should be the appropriate "service name" from the IANA Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry.

title.title: Protocol Title
title.description: A human readable name for the protocol (e.g., Transport Layer Security).

port_range.title: Port Range
port_range.description: Where applicable this is the IPv4 port range on which the service operates.

start.title: Start
start.description: Indicates the starting port number in a port range

end.title: End
end.description: Indicates the ending port number in a port range

implementation_status.title: Implementation Status
implementation_status.description: Indicates the degree to which the a given control is implemented.

state.title: Implementation State
state.description: Identifies the implementation status of the control or control objective.

system_user.title: System User
system_user.description: A type of user that interacts with the system based on an associated role.

uuid.title: User Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: The unique identifier for the user class.

title.title: User Title
title.description: A name given to the user, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short_name.title: User Short Name
short_name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the user.

description.title: User Description
description.description: A summary of the user's purpose within the system.

authorized_privilege.title: Privilege
authorized_privilege.description: Identifies a specific system privilege held by the user, along with an associated description and/or rationale for the privilege.

title.title: Privilege Title
title.description: A human readable name for the privilege.

description.title: Privilege Description
description.description: A summary of the privilege's purpose within the system.

function_performed.title: Functions Performed
function_performed.description: Describes a function performed for a given authorized privilege by this user class.

inventory_item.title: Inventory Item
inventory_item.description: A single managed inventory item within the system.

uuid.title: Inventory Item Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this inventory item entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

description.title: Inventory Item Description
description.description: A summary of the inventory item stating its purpose within the system.

implemented_component.title: Implemented Component
implemented_component.description: The set of components that are implemented in a given system inventory item.

component_uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component_uuid.description: A reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

set_parameter.title: Set Parameter Value
set_parameter.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

param_id.title: Parameter ID
param_id.description: A reference to a parameter within a control, who's catalog has been imported into the current implementation context.

items.title: Parameter Value
items.description: A parameter value or set of values.

system_id.title: System Identification
system_id.description: A unique identifier for the system described by this system security plan.

identifier_type.title: Identification System Type
identifier_type.description: Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

system_security_plan.title: System Security Plan (SSP)
system_security_plan.description: A system security plan, such as those described in NIST SP 800_18

uuid.title: System Security Plan Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier for this catalog instance. This UUID should be changed when this document is revised.

import_profile.title: Import Profile
import_profile.description: Used to import the OSCAL profile representing the system's control baseline.

href.title: Profile Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to the profile to use as the system's control baseline.

system_characteristics.title: System Characteristics
system_characteristics.description: Contains the characteristics of the system, such as its name, purpose, and security impact level.

system_name.title: System Name _ Full
system_name.description: The full name of the system.

system_name_short.title: System Name _ Short
system_name_short.description: A short name for the system, such as an acronym, that is suitable for display in a data table or summary list.

description.title: System Description
description.description: A summary of the system.

security_sensitivity_level.title: Security Sensitivity Level
security_sensitivity_level.description: The overall information system sensitivity categorization, such as defined by FIPS_199.

information_type.title: Information Type
information_type.description: Contains details about one information type that is stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800_60.

uuid.title: Information Type Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this information type entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

title.title: title field
title.description: A human readable name for the information type. This title should be meaningful within the context of the system.

description.title: Information Type Description
description.description: A summary of how this information type is used within the system.

items.title: Information Type Categorization
items.description: A set of information type identifiers qualified by the given identification system used, such as NIST SP 800_60.

system.title: Information Type Identification System
system.description: Specifies the information type identification system used.

items.title: Information Type Systematized Identifier
items.description: An identifier qualified by the given identification system used, such as NIST SP 800_60.

confidentiality_impact.title: Confidentiality Impact Level
confidentiality_impact.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the unauthorized disclosure of the described information.

integrity_impact.title: Integrity Impact Level
integrity_impact.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the unauthorized modification of the described information.

availability_impact.title: Availability Impact Level
availability_impact.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the disruption of access to or use of the described information or the information system.

system_information.title: System Information
system_information.description: Contains details about all information types that are stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800_60.

base.title: Base Level (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability)
base.description: The prescribed base (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

selected.title: Selected Level (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability)
selected.description: The selected (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

adjustment_justification.title: Adjustment Justification
adjustment_justification.description: If the selected security level is different from the base security level, this contains the justification for the change.

security_impact_level.title: Security Impact Level
security_impact_level.description: The overall level of expected impact resulting from unauthorized disclosure, modification, or loss of access to information.

security_objective_confidentiality.title: Security Objective: Confidentiality
security_objective_confidentiality.description: A target_level of confidentiality for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

security_objective_integrity.title: Security Objective: Integrity
security_objective_integrity.description: A target_level of integrity for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

security_objective_availability.title: Security Objective: Availability
security_objective_availability.description: A target_level of availability for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

system_status.title: Status
system_status.description: Describes the operational status of the system.

date_authorized.title: System Authorization Date
date_authorized.description: The date the system received its authorization.

authorization_boundary.title: Authorization Boundary
authorization_boundary.description: A description of this system's authorization boundary, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the authorization boundary.

description.title: Authorization Boundary Description
description.description: A summary of the system's authorization boundary.

remarks.title: remarks field
remarks.description: Commentary about the system's authorization boundary that enhances the diagram.

diagram.title: Diagram
diagram.description: A graphic that provides a visual representation the system, or some aspect of it.

uuid.title: Diagram ID
uuid.description: The identifier for this diagram.

description.title: Diagram Description
description.description: A summary of the diagram.

caption.title: Caption
caption.description: A brief caption to annotate the diagram.

remarks.title: remarks field
remarks.description: Commentary about the diagram that enhances it.

network_architecture.title: Network Architecture
network_architecture.description: A description of the system's network architecture, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the network architecture.

description.title: Network Architecture Description
description.description: A summary of the system's network architecture.

data_flow.title: Data Flow
data_flow.description: A description of the logical flow of information within the system and across its boundaries, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate these flows.

description.title: Data Flow Description
description.description: A summary of the system's data flow.

leveraged_authorization.title: Leveraged Authorization
leveraged_authorization.description: A description of another authorized system from which this system inherits capabilities that satisfy security requirements. Another term for this concept is a common control provider.

uuid.title: Leveraged Authorization Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this leveraged authorization entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

title.title: title field
title.description: A human readable name for the leveraged authorization in the context of the system.

party_uuid.title: Leveraged Authorization Manager
party_uuid.description: A reference to the party that manages the leveraged system.

system_implementation.title: System Implementation
system_implementation.description: Provides information as to how the system is implemented.

control_implementation.title: Control Implementation
control_implementation.description: Describes how the system satisfies a set of controls.

description.title: Control Implementation Description
description.description: A statement describing important things to know about how this set of control satisfaction documentation is approached.

implemented_requirement.title: Control Based Requirement
implemented_requirement.description: Describes how the system satisfies an individual control.

uuid.title: Control Requirement Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this control requirement entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

control_id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control_id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value.

statement.title: Specific Control Statement
statement.description: Identifies which statements within a control are addressed.

statement_id.title: Control Statement Reference
statement_id.description: A reference to a control statement by its identifier

uuid.title: Control Statement Reference Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this control statement entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

export.title: Export
export.description: Identifies content intended for external consumption, such as with leveraged organizations.

description.title: Control Implementation Export Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be available to another system leveraging this system.

items.title: Provided Control Implementation
items.description: Describes a capability which may be inherited by a leveraging system.

uuid.title: Provided Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this provided entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

description.title: Provided Control Implementation Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be provided to another system leveraging this system.

by_component.title: Component Control Implementation
by_component.description: Defines how the referenced component implements a set of controls.

component_uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component_uuid.description: A reference to the component that is implementing a given control or control statement.

uuid.title: By_Component Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this by_component entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

description.title: Control Implementation Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes how a control or a control statement is implemented within the referenced system component.

assessment_plan.title: Security Assessment Plan (SAP)
assessment_plan.description: An assessment plan, such as those provided by a FedRAMP assessor.

uuid.title: Assessment Plan Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment plan. This UUID must be changed each time the content of the plan changes.

local_definitions.title: Local Definitions
local_definitions.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

terms_and_conditions.title: Assessment Plan Terms and Conditions
terms_and_conditions.description: Used to define various terms and conditions under which an assessment, described by the plan, can be performed. Each child part defines a different type of term or condition.

import_ssp.title: Import System Security Plan
import_ssp.description: Used by the assessment plan and POA&M to import information about the system.

href.title: System Security Plan Reference
href.description: >A resolvable URL reference to the system security plan for the system being assessed.

local_objective.title: Assessment_Specific Control Objective
local_objective.description: A local definition of a control objective for this assessment. Uses catalog syntax for control objective and assessment actions.

control_id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control_id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value.

description.title: Objective Description
description.description: A description of this control objective.

assessment_method.title: Assessment Method
assessment_method.description: A local definition of a control objective. Uses catalog syntax for control objective and assessment activities.

uuid.title: Assessment Method Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this defined assessment method. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for a given assessment method across revisions of the document.

description.title: Assessment Method Description
description.description: A description of this assessment method.

activity_step.title: Step
activity_step.description: Identifies an individual step in a series of steps related to an activity, such as an assessment test or examination procedure.

uuid.title: Step Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies a step. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this step. A UUID should be consistently used for a given test step across revisions of the document.

title.title: Step Title
title.description: The title for this step.

description.title: Step Description
description.description: A description of this step.

activity.title: Activity
activity.description: Identifies an assessment or related process that can be performed. In the assessment plan, this is an intended activity which may be associated with an assessment task. In the assessment results, this an activity that was actually performed as part of an assessment.

uuid.title: Assessment Activity Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment activity. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for a given included activity across revisions of the document.

title.title: Included Activity Title
title.description: The title for this included activity.

description.title: Included Activity Description
description.description: A description of this included activity.

task.title: Task
task.description: Represents a scheduled event or milestone, which may be associated with a series of assessment actions.

uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment task.

title.title: Task Title
title.description: The title for this task.

description.title: Task Description
description.description: A description of this task.

timing.title: Event Timing
timing.description: The timing under which the task is intended to occur.

on_date.title: On Date Condition
on_date.description: The task is intended to occur on the specified date.

date.title: On Date Condition
date.description: The task must occur on the specified date.

within_date_range.title: On Date Range Condition
within_date_range.description: The task is intended to occur within the specified date range.

start.title: Start Date Condition
start.description: The task must occur on or after the specified date.

end.title: End Date Condition
end.description: The task must occur on or before the specified date.

at_frequency.title: Frequency Condition
at_frequency.description: The task is intended to occur at the specified frequency.

period.title: Period
period.description: The task must occur after the specified period has elapsed.

unit.title: Time Unit
unit.description: The unit of time for the period.

items.title: Task Dependency
items.description: Used to indicate that a task is dependent on another task.

task_uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier Reference
task_uuid.description: References a unique task by UUID.

items.title: Associated Activity
items.description: Identifies an individual activity to be performed as part of a task.

activity_uuid.title: Activity Universally Unique Identifier Reference
activity_uuid.description: References an activity defined in the list of activities.

assessed_controls.title: Assessed Controls
assessed_controls.description: Identifies the controls being assessed. In the assessment plan, these are the planned controls. In the assessment results, these are the actual controls, and reflects any changes from the plan.

description.title: Assessed Controls Description
description.description: A description of in_scope controls specified for assessment.

include_all.title: All
include_all.description: A key word to indicate all.

reviewed_controls.title: Reviewed Controls and Control Objectives
reviewed_controls.description: Identifies the controls being assessed and their control objectives.

description.title: Control Objective Description
description.description: A description of control objectives.

referenced_control_objectives.title: Referenced Control Objectives
referenced_control_objectives.description: Identifies the control objectives of the assessment. In the assessment plan, these are the planned objectives. In the assessment results, these are the assessed objectives, and reflects any changes from the plan.

description.title: Control Objectives Description
description.description: A description of this collection of control objectives.

include_all.title: All
include_all.description: A key word to indicate all.

select_control_by_id.title: Select Control
select_control_by_id.description: Used to select a control for inclusion/exclusion based on one or more control identifiers. A set of statement identifiers can be used to target the inclusion/exclusion to only specific control statements providing more granularity over the specific statements that are within the asessment scope.

control_id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control_id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value.

items.title: Include Specific Statements
items.description: Used to constrain the selection to only specificity identified statements.

select_objective_by_id.title: Select Objective
select_objective_by_id.description: Used to select a control objective for inclusion/exclusion based on the control objective's identifier.

assessment_subject_placeholder.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder
assessment_subject_placeholder.description: Used when the assessment subjects will be determined as part of one or more other assessment activities. These assessment subjects will be recorded in the assessment results in the assessment log.

uuid.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies a set of assessment subjects that will be identified by a task or an activity that is part of a task.

description.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Description
description.description: A description of intent of this assessment subject placeholder.

items.title: Assessment Subject Source
items.description: Assessment subjects will be identified while conducting the referenced activity_instance.

task_uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier
task_uuid.description: Uniquely identifies an assessment activity to be performed as part of the event. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for this schedule across revisions of the document.

assessment_subject.title: Subject of Assessment
assessment_subject.description: Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and locations. In the assessment plan, this identifies a planned assessment subject. In the assessment results this is an actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes from the plan. exactly what will be the focus of this assessment. Any subjects not identified in this way are out_of_scope.

type.title: Subject Type
type.description: Indicates the type of assessment subject, such as a component, inventory, item, location, or party represented by this selection statement.

description.title: Include Subjects Description
description.description: A description of the collection of subjects being included in this assessment.

include_all.title: All
include_all.description: A key word to indicate all.

select_subject_by_id.title: Select Assessment Subject
select_subject_by_id.description: Identifies a set of assessment subjects to include/exclude by UUID.

subject_uuid.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference
subject_uuid.description: A pointer to a component, inventory_item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

type.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference Type
type.description: Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the uuid_ref within a subject.

subject_reference.title: Identifies the Subject
subject_reference.description: A pointer to a resource based on its universally unique identifier (UUID). Use type to indicate whether the identified resource is a component, inventory item, location, user, or something else.

subject_uuid.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference
subject_uuid.description: A pointer to a component, inventory_item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

type.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference Type
type.description: Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the uuid_ref within a subject.

title.title: Subject Reference Title
title.description: The title or name for the referenced subject.

assessment_assets.title: Assessment Assets
assessment_assets.description: Identifies the assets used to perform this assessment, such as the assessment team, scanning tools, and assumptions.

uses_component.title: Uses Component
uses_component.description: The set of components that are used.

component_uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component_uuid.description: A reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

relevant_evidence_link.title: Relevant Evidence
relevant_evidence_link.description: Links this observation to relevant evidence.

href.title: Relevant Evidence Reference
href.description: >A resolvable URL reference to relevant evidence.

description.title: Relevant Evidence Description
description.description: A description of this evidence.

assessment_platform.title: Assessment Platform
assessment_platform.description: Used to represent the toolset used to perform aspects of the assessment.

uuid.title: Assessment Platform Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment Platform.

title.title: Assessment Platform Title
title.description: The title or name for the assessment platform.

finding_target.title: Objective Status
finding_target.description: Captures an assessor's conclusions regarding the degree to which an objective is satisfied.

type.title: Finding Target Type
type.description: Identifies the type of the target.

target_id.title: Finding Target Identifier Reference
target_id.description: Identifies the specific target qualified by the type.

title.title: Objective Status Title
title.description: The title for this objective status.

description.title: Objective Status Description
description.description: A description of the assessor's conclusions regarding the degree to which an objective is satisfied.

status.title: Objective Status
status.description: A determination of if the objective is satisfied or not within a given system.

state.title: Objective Status State
state.description: An indication as to whether the objective is satisfied or not.

reason.title: Objective Status Reason
reason.description: The reason the objective was given it's status.

uuid.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this observation. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given observation across revisions.

title.title: Observation Title
title.description: The title for this observation.

description.title: Observation Description
description.description: A description of this assessment observation.

items.title: Observation Method
items.description: Identifies how the observation was made.

items.title: Observation Type
items.description: Identifies the nature of the observation. More than one may be used to further qualify and enable filtering.

collected.title: collected field
collected.description: Date/time stamp identifying when the finding information was collected.

expires.title: expires field
expires.description: Date/time identifying when the finding information is out_of_date and no longer valid. Typically used with continuous assessment scenarios.

origin.title: Origin
origin.description: Identifies the source of the finding, such as a tool, interviewed person, or activity.

origin_actor.title: Originating Actor
origin_actor.description: The actor that produces an observation, a finding, or a risk. One or more actor type can be used to specify a person that is using a tool.

actor_uuid.title: Actor Universally Unique Identifier Reference
actor_uuid.description: A pointer to the tool or person based on the associated type.

role_id.title: Actor Role
role_id.description: For a party, this can optionally be used to specify the role the actor was performing.

related_task.title: Task Reference
related_task.description: Identifies an individual task for which the containing object is a consequence of.

task_uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier Reference
task_uuid.description: References a unique task by UUID.

identified_subject.title: Identified Subject
identified_subject.description: Used to detail assessment subjects that were identfied by this task.

subject_placeholder_uuid.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier Reference
subject_placeholder_uuid.description: References a unique assessment subject placeholder defined by this task.

threat_id.title: Threat ID
threat_id.description: A pointer, by ID, to an externally_defined threat.

system.title: Threat Type Identification System
system.description: Specifies the source of the threat information.

href.title: Threat Information Resource Reference
href.description: An optional location for the threat data, from which this ID originates.

mitigating_factor.title: Mitigating Factor
mitigating_factor.description: Describes an existing mitigating factor that may affect the overall determination of the risk, with an optional link to an implementation statement in the SSP.

uuid.title: Mitigating Factor Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this mitigating factor. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given mitigating factor across revisions.

implementation_uuid.title: Implementation UUID
implementation_uuid.description: Points to an implementation statement in the SSP.

description.title: Mitigating Factor Description
description.description: A description of this mitigating factor.

uuid.title: Risk Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this risk. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given risk across revisions.

title.title: Risk Title
title.description: The title for this risk.

description.title: Risk Description
description.description: A summary of the identified risk, to include a statement of how the risk impacts the system.

statement.title: Risk Statement
statement.description: An summary of impact for how the risk affects the system.

status.title: Status
status.description: Describes the status of the associated risk.

deadline.title: Risk Resolution Deadline
deadline.description: The date/time by which the risk must be resolved.

risk_log.title: Risk Log
risk_log.description: A log of all risk_related tasks taken.

items.title: Related Observation
items.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

observation_uuid.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier Reference
observation_uuid.description: References an observation defined in the list of observations.

risk_log_entry.title: Risk Log Entry
risk_log_entry.description: Identifies an individual risk response that occurred as part of managing an identified risk.

uuid.title: Risk Log Entry Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies a risk log entry. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for this schedule across revisions of the document.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for this risk log entry.

description.title: Risk Task Description
description.description: A description of what was done regarding the risk.

start.title: Start
start.description: Identifies the start date and time of the event.

end.title: End
end.description: Identifies the end date and time of the event. If the event is a point in time, the start and end will be the same date and time.

items.title: Risk Response Reference
items.description: Identifies an individual risk response that this log entry is for.

response_uuid.title: Response Universally Unique Identifier Reference
response_uuid.description: References a unique risk response by UUID.

logged_by.title: Logged By
logged_by.description: Used to indicate who created a log entry in what role.

party_uuid.title: Party UUID Reference
party_uuid.description: A pointer to the party who is making the log entry.

role_id.title: Actor Role
role_id.description: A point to the role_id of the role in which the party is making the log entry.

risk_status.title: Risk Status
risk_status.description: Describes the status of the associated risk.

characterization.title: Characterization
characterization.description: A collection of descriptive data about the containing object from a specific origin.

items.title: Facet
items.description: An individual characteristic that is part of a larger set produced by the same actor.

name.title: Facet Name
name.description: The name of the risk metric within the specified system.

system.title: Naming System
system.description: Specifies the naming system under which this risk metric is organized, which allows for the same names to be used in different systems controlled by different parties. This avoids the potential of a name clash.

value.title: Facet Value
value.description: Indicates the value of the facet.

required_asset.title: Required Asset
required_asset.description: Identifies an asset required to achieve remediation.

uuid.title: Required Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this required asset. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given required asset across revisions.

title.title: Title for Required Asset
title.description: The title for this required asset.

description.title: Description of Required Asset
description.description: A description of this required asset.

response.title: Risk Response
response.description: Describes either recommended or an actual plan for addressing the risk.

uuid.title: Remediation Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this remediation. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given remediation across revisions.

lifecycle.title: Remediation Intent
lifecycle.description: Identifies whether this is a recommendation, such as from an assessor or tool, or an actual plan accepted by the system owner.

title.title: Response Title
title.description: The title for this response activity.

description.title: Response Description
description.description: A description of this response plan.

assessment_part.title: Assessment Part
assessment_part.description: A partition of an assessment plan or results or a child of another part.

uuid.title: Part Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for a specific part instance. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same part across minor revisions of the document.

name.title: Part Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type.

ns.title: Part Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

class.title: Part Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub_type or characterization of the part's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple parts of the same control with the same name and ns.

title.title: Part Title
title.description: A name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

prose.title: Part Text
prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

mission.title: Organization Mission
mission.description: A mission statement defines what line of business an organization is in, and why it exists or what purpose it serves.

business_functions.title: Business functions
business_functions.description: Functions carried out by an organization

items.title: Business Function
items.description: A Function that a business or enterprise performs

title.title: Business Function Title
title.description: Human readable shortname for a business function

description.title: Business Function Description
description.description: Details of a business function

assessment_results_local_definitions.title: Local Definitions
assessment_results_local_definitions.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

assessment_results.title: Security Assessment Results (SAR)
assessment_results.description: Security assessment results, such as those provided by a FedRAMP assessor in the FedRAMP Security Assessment Report.

uuid.title: Assessment Results Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment results file. This UUID must be changed each time the content of the results changes.

attestation_statements.title: Attestation Statements
attestation_statements.description: A set of textual statements, typically written by the assessor.

result.title: Assessment Result
result.description: Used by the assessment results and POA&M. In the assessment results, this identifies all of the assessment observations and findings, initial and residual risks, deviations, and disposition. In the POA&M, this identifies initial and residual risks, deviations, and disposition.

uuid.title: Results Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this set of results. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given set of results across revisions.

title.title: Results Title
title.description: The title for this set of results.

description.title: Results Description
description.description: A description of this set of test results.

start.title: start field
start.description: Date/time stamp identifying the start of the evidence collection reflected in these results.

end.title: end field
end.description: Date/time stamp identifying the end of the evidence collection reflected in these results. In a continuous motoring scenario, this may contain the same value as start if appropriate.

local_definitions.title: Local Definitions
local_definitions.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

assessment_log.title: Assessment Log
assessment_log.description: A log of all assessment_related actions taken.

items.title: Assessment Log Entry
items.description: Identifies the result of an action and/or task that occurred as part of executing an assessment plan or an assessment event that occurred in producing the assessment results.

uuid.title: Assessment Log Entry Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies an assessment event. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for this schedule across revisions of the document.

title.title: Action Title
title.description: The title for this event.

description.title: Action Description
description.description: A description of this event.

start.title: Start
start.description: Identifies the start date and time of an event.

end.title: End
end.description: Identifies the end date and time of an event. If the event is a point in time, the start and end will be the same date and time.

uuid.title: Finding Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this finding. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given finding across revisions.

title.title: Finding Title
title.description: The title for this finding.

description.title: Finding Description
description.description: A description of this finding.

implementation_statement_uuid.title: Implementation Statement UUID
implementation_statement_uuid.description: Identifies the implementation statement in the SSP to which this finding is related.

items.title: Related Observation
items.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

observation_uuid.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier Reference
observation_uuid.description: References an observation defined in the list of observations.

items.title: Associated Risk
items.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced risks that were used to determine the finding.

risk_uuid.title: Risk Universally Unique Identifier Reference
risk_uuid.description: References an risk defined in the list of risks.

import_ap.title: Import Assessment Plan
import_ap.description: Used by assessment_results to import information about the original plan for assessing the system.

href.title: Assessment Plan Reference
href.description: >A resolvable URL reference to the assessment plan governing the assessment activities.

plan_of_action_and_milestones.title: Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M)
plan_of_action_and_milestones.description: A plan of action and milestones which identifies initial and residual risks, deviations, and disposition, such as those required by FedRAMP.

uuid.title: POA&M Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this POA&M. This UUID must be changed each time the content of the POA&M changes.

poam_local_definitions.title: Local Definitions
poam_local_definitions.description: Allows components, and inventory_items to be defined within the POA&M for circumstances where no OSCAL_based SSP exists, or is not delivered with the POA&M.

uuid.title: POA&M Item Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies the POA&M entry. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for a given POA&M item across revisions of the document.

title.title: POA&M Item Title
title.description: The title or name for this POA&M item .

description.title: POA&M Item Description
description.description: A description of POA&M item.

items.title: Related Observation
items.description: Relates the poam_item to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

observation_uuid.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier Reference
observation_uuid.description: References an observation defined in the list of observations.

items.title: Associated Risk
items.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced risks that were used to determine the finding.

risk_uuid.title: Risk Universally Unique Identifier Reference
risk_uuid.description: References an risk defined in the list of risks.
